column3: Lock up your arcanists and hide the heavy equipment, Master Gegeruju is feeling bored.
Master Gegeruju's idea is refreshingly harmless. In order to call up the winds, first collect three cores from a wind sprite.
You collected three wind sprite cores. Place them at the tip of the nearby cliffs to summon a storm sprite.
Nature is not to be trifled with\xe2\x94\x80the storm sprite attacks you. Report to Master Gegeruju.
Far from apologetic, Master Gegeruju pouts that he only felt a whiffle. There is no greater adventure than serving at his pleasure.
Place the wind sprite cores at the tip of the cliffs.
Excellent timing, come, come! Such a still, wilting day and I had a thought\xe2\x94\x80a little thought, a violet not a rose\xe2\x94\x80to call up a refreshing breeze.
The wind sprites now, you can get a healthy puff or two out of them. It follows that a powerful sprite can set a whole city aflutter!

According to my best calculations\xe2\x94\x80or rather my \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03second\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 best calculations, no need to ask how or why\xe2\x94\x80collecting three cores from wind sprites should permit you to summon a more powerful specimen.
Won't someone\xe2\x94\x80present company definitely included\xe2\x94\x80carry out my genius plan? Will someone deign to collect this handsome reward?
So only \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03you\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 enjoyed a refreshing buffeting? I had but a whimpering whiffle! Oh, phooey, now I shall be bored again.
